title: (x) "Esplanade Dr" road sign - (similar to) Helvetica Inserat {Mark S}
content:
Hopefully someone can tell me what font this is. We're wondering...   
   
 ![esplanade](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021142im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/39378.jpg)
author: karen

comments.content: I'll double check, but at first glance it looks like Helvetica Black (or Bold?) Condensed.

Sorry, I think Folio Bold Condensed is a closer match:   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/folio/ef-bold-condensed/testdrive.html?s=E+S+P+L+A+N+A+D+E+++D+R&p=48](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021142/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/folio/ef-bold-condensed/testdrive.html?s=E%2BS%2BP%2BL%2BA%2BN%2BA%2BD%2BE%2B%2B%2BD%2BR&p=48)   
   
Tough to whether the difference in the roundness of the top of the S is due to the angle of the photo, the reproduction quality of the lettering on the sign, or whether it's one of a dozen other bold condensed gothics.

It looks pretty damn close, but seems too bold?   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/folio/ef-bold-condensed/testdrive.html?s=ESPLANADE+DR&p=72](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021142/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/folio/ef-bold-condensed/testdrive.html?s=ESPLANADE%2BDR&p=72)   
   
What do you think?   
   
 [Here's](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021142/http:/www.manic.com.sg/blog/archives/000170.php) my post if you're interested.

You may be right, Karen. Here's a quickie attempt to simulate the sign with Folio Bold Condensed.   
   
 ![esplanade](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021142im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/39387.jpg)   
   
I think the perspective and a little "squooshing" might account for the differences in weight, but the S and R are little rounder in your sample. And the middle stroke of the N is too light in Folio.   
   
The S looks like it was borrowed from Franklin Gothic, Knockout or some other 19th-Century sans.
I'm sure we'll have our answer once the real experts in Europe and the Americas wake up... ;-)

No ones having a crack at this one yet. ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021142im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)   
   
Wakey wakey!

Another one that is close is [Helvetica Inserat](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021142/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica-inserat/helvetica-inserat/testdrive.html?s=ESPLANADE%a0DR&p=72), although there are some small differences:   
   
 ![esplanade](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110021142im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/39422.jpg)
Hey, this is really close. The only differences I can spot are the diagonal on the N and the eye of the P. And it could be the angle of the photo too. Thanks Mark!!!
